subject: Probability Theory (Measure-Theoretic)
title: Probability Theory (TUM, Module MA2409)
description: Measure-theoretic probability: independence of sigma-algebras/RVs, Kolmogorov extension, Borel–Cantelli, 0–1 law, LLN and CLT (L², Lindeberg–Feller), characteristic functions and weak convergence, conditional expectation, martingales (inequalities, convergence, optional stopping). Workload 270 h (90 h contact), 9 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2023s responsible: Rolles, Silke.

goals.title: Probability Theory – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner masters measure-theoretic probability, including independence, LLN/CLT via characteristic functions, conditional expectation, and martingale theory with convergence and stopping.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner masters measure-theoretic probability, including independence, LLN/CLT via characteristic functions, conditional expectation, and martingale theory with convergence and stopping.

goals.title: Independence & Extensions
goals.description: Learner can formalize independence of sigma-algebras/random variables, apply Kolmogorov extension theorem, and use Borel–Cantelli and 0–1 laws.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can formalize independence of sigma-algebras/random variables, apply Kolmogorov extension theorem, and use Borel–Cantelli and 0–1 laws.

goals.title: Laws of Large Numbers
goals.description: Learner can prove and apply weak and strong laws of large numbers for sequences of independent random variables.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can prove and apply weak and strong laws of large numbers for sequences of independent random variables.

goals.title: Characteristic Functions & Weak Convergence
goals.description: Learner can work with characteristic functions, establish weak convergence results, and use them to derive central limit theorems (including Lindeberg–Feller).
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can work with characteristic functions, establish weak convergence results, and use them to derive central limit theorems (including Lindeberg–Feller).

goals.title: Central Limit Theorems
goals.description: Learner can prove CLT for L² random variables and the Lindeberg–Feller theorem and apply them to sums of independent variables.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can prove CLT for L² random variables and the Lindeberg–Feller theorem and apply them to sums of independent variables.

goals.title: Conditional Expectation
goals.description: Learner can define conditional expectation with respect to a sigma-algebra, establish its properties, and use it in computations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can define conditional expectation with respect to a sigma-algebra, establish its properties, and use it in computations.

goals.title: Martingales & Optional Stopping
goals.description: Learner can apply martingale inequalities and convergence theorems and justify optional stopping results in discrete time.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can apply martingale inequalities and convergence theorems and justify optional stopping results in discrete time.

descriptionEn: Measure-theoretic probability: independence of sigma-algebras/RVs, Kolmogorov extension, Borel–Cantelli, 0–1 law, LLN and CLT (L², Lindeberg–Feller), characteristic functions and weak convergence, conditional expectation, martingales (inequalities, convergence, optional stopping). Workload 270 h (90 h contact), 9 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2023s responsible: Rolles, Silke.
